resources.string: Your kernel has a bug, please forward this URL link to your ROM/Kernel developer. As result, you may experience lag using this app.
Fatal Error, please see notification drawer.
Please restart me with root permissions.
While Tame no longer requires SuperSU on Lollipop, I still suggest using it to avoid any potential issues.
It appears that you previously used Tame from a different device. While you shouldn\'t run into any problems, you may consider resetting my data.
Reboot your device for the changes to take effect.
Value saved, and queued to Run At Boot.
You most likely have a non-kernel based plug manager.
Android naturally resets most kernel settings to default after a reboot. Enabling this will restore your custom settings.

After a reboot, Tame may take a minute or two to restore settings.

 In the event that you screwed up and you want to disable Tame Settings from recovery, there is a flash-able zip on your sdcard.
All of Tame\'s startup services have been disabled. You will have to re-enable them yourself. Keep in mind all your Tame data is still saved, just not applied.
Failed to extract zip to %1$s. Do you have an sdcard?
Extracted emergency zip to %1$s. Flash in recovery when you wish to disable automatic restore.
Check for an update to Tame or WildKernel on boot.
Pulse button lights when a notification is received.
Configure different ways to wake your device from sleep.
Reducing the screen\'s power consumption can improve battery life.
Colors may appear slightly distorted, but this is safe to use.
Increase mA current during charging. Only affects non-wall chargers.
Raises the minimum processor speed while you\'re browsing. Useful to circumvent UI Lag.
Utilizes an algorithm to determine when to boost cores. Higher the threshold, the more likely an event will trigger a boost.
Touch Boosting must be disabled while changing policies, as it may interfere with processor policies.

Boosts are issued based off priority. Set your frequencies from greatest to least, with Processor #1 being the maximum possible boost, as it\'s the highest priority. \n\nNote: No boost frequency should be above your maximum CPU frequency, as boosts simply raise the CPU minimum frequency.
Group more processes onto primary core.
Schedule shell commands to be executed every startup. While this is independent of Tame\'s Set On Boot, this will disable itself if the SOB disabler zip is flashed.
Commands will be executed using root permissions, so no need to request.
Commands queued for next device boot.
Automatically restore saved properties when they\'re changed (ROM change etc.)
Build.prop updated, reboot your device to apply changes.
Rename and replace your /system/build.prop with %1$s or click below to restore, incase of problems.\n

I HIGHLY recommend not attempting this on your current ROM (5.0+), as it will most likely break your ROM past repair. SELinux broke my current method and I\'m still working on a workaround to this, but for now only use this on KitKat and below.\n
Backup build.prop restored, please reboot your device.
Higher the current, faster the charge. All these settings are safe to use.
Unplug secondary cores while screen off
Mpdecision automatically plugs/unplugs cores based off workload.
Don\'t lower past 500MHz, your phone has a built in Low Power Mode.
Plug extra processor during touch events
Intelli-Plug automatically plugs/unplugs cores based off workload.

Unplugging a processor here will disable it until you re-enable it, as oppose to allowing an SMP manager to automatically control when it\'s enabled. This has the potential to reduce power consumption, but may have also reduce performance if unbalanced. Consider raising your maximum frequency, when disabling multiple processors. This maintains a balance while still saving power.
Always unplug from bottom to top, to avoid issues. So processor #2 should not be disabled if processor #3 is not disabled.
%1$s from %2$s is now available to download.
This log is stored at %1$s for your convenience.\n\n%2$s
Debugging mode slows down the functionality app. Only use it when needed.
